Rencana Kenaikan Harga Rokok Picu Inflasi di Madiun
05 Nov 2019, 09:11 by Eka Wulan



Rencana Kenaikan Harga Rokok Picu Inflasi di Madiun



Rencana Kenaikan Harga Rokok Picu Inflasi di Madiun


KBRN, Madiun : Rencana pemerintah menaikkan cukai pada tahun 2020 memicu inflasi nasional pada Oktober 2019, tidak terkecuali di Kota Madiun. Kenaikan cukai hasil tembakau dan harga jual eceran (HJE) yang akan berlaku mulai 2020 itu termuat dalam Peraturan Menteri Keuangan No. 152/2019 tentang tarif cukai hasil tembakau. Adapun besaran kenaikan cukainya sebesar 22 persen dan harga eceran sebesar 35 persen.
Kasi Statistik Distribusi Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) Kota, Ida Ayu Damayanti mengatakan, rokok kretek filter tercatat mengalami kenaikan harga sekitar 1,48 persen dengan andil inflasi 0,03 persen. Kemungkinan hal itu disebabkan sebagai salah satu upaya agar konsumen tidak kaget saat  harga rokok naik.
“Mungkin produsen memang ancang-ancang, jadi mulai menaikkan biar nanti pas Januari 2020 tidak langsung tinggi (harganya) gitu,” ungkap Ida, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Ida memperkirakan, harga rokok terus mengalami kenaikan dengan prosentase kecil disisa akhir tahun ini. Selain rokok kretek filter, ada sejumlah komoditas yang mengalami kenaikan harga. Diantaranya daging ayam ras, tomat sayur, bawang merah, telur ayam ras dan cabai rawit. Sebaliknya,sejumlah komoditi yang mengalami penurunan harga diantaranya pada bawang putih, apel, buah pir dan emas perhiasan.
Ia menyebut, inflasi Kota Madiun pada Oktober 2019 masih terkendali yakni sebesar 0,07 persen dengan Indeks Harga Konsumen (IHK) 134,35. Hanya saja, angka tersebut diatas inflasi nasional sebesar 0,02 persen, dan Jawa Timur -0,02 persen.
Dijelaskan, dari delapan kota penghitung inflasi nasional di Jatim, tiga kota mengalami deflasi dan lima kota mengalami inflasi. Tertinggi, terjadi di Kediri sebesar 0,32 persen, Sumenep 0,30 persen, Probolinggo 0,12 persen, Madiun 0,07 persen. Selanjutnya Jember 0,05 persen, Malang -0,04 persen, Surabaya -0,08 persen dan Banyuwangi -0,09 persen.

Plans to Increase Cigarette Prices Trigger Inflation in Madiun
05 Nov 2019, 09:11 by Eka Wulan



Plans to Increase Cigarette Prices Trigger Inflation in Madiun



Plans to Increase Cigarette Prices Trigger Inflation in Madiun


KBRN, Madiun: The government's plan to increase excise duty in 2020 triggers national inflation in October 2019, including in the City of Madiun. The increase in tobacco product excise and retail sale price (HJE), which will take effect from 2020, is contained in Minister of Finance Regulation No. 152/2019 concerning tobacco excise tax rates. The amount of the increase in excise is 22 percent and the retail price is 35 percent.
Head of Statistics Distribution Division of the Central Statistics Agency (BPS) of the City, Ida Ayu Damayanti said, filtered clove cigarettes recorded a price increase of about 1.48 percent with an inflation share of 0.03 percent. It is likely that this is caused as an effort so that consumers are not surprised when cigarette prices rise.
"Maybe the producers are indeed square off, so starting to raise it so that later in January 2020 it will not be directly high (the price)," said Ida, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
Ida estimates, cigarette prices continue to rise with a small percentage remaining at the end of this year. In addition to filter clove cigarettes, there are a number of commodities that have experienced price increases. Among them purebred chicken, tomatoes, onions, eggs and cayenne peppers. Conversely, a number of commodities that experienced a price decline include garlic, apples, pears and gold jewelry.
He said, the inflation of the City of Madiun in October 2019 was still under control that is equal to 0.07 percent with the Consumer Price Index (CPI) 134.35. However, the figure is above the national inflation of 0.02 percent, and East Java -0.02 percent.
It was explained, from eight cities that calculate national inflation in East Java, three cities experienced deflation and five cities experienced inflation. The highest, occurred in Kediri by 0.32 percent, Sumenep 0.30 percent, Probolinggo 0.12 percent, Madiun 0.07 percent. Then Jember 0.05 percent, Malang -0.04 percent, Surabaya -0.08 percent and Banyuwangi -0.09 percent.
